definitions.definition: The act of excepting or excluding; exclusion; restriction by taking out something which would otherwise be included, as in a class, statement, rule.
That which is excluded from others; a person, thing, or case, specified as distinct, or not included.
examples: That rule is usually true, but there are a few exceptions .

definitions.definition: An objection , on legal grounds; also, as in conveyancing, a clause by which the grantor excepts or reserves something before the right is transferred.
An objection; cavil ; dissent ; disapprobation; offense; cause of offense.
labels: usually followed by to or against
definitions.label_groups: usually followed by to or against

definitions.definition: An interruption in normal processing , typically caused by an error condition , that can be raised (" thrown ") by one part of the program and handled (" caught ") by another part.

main_definition: The act of excepting or excluding; exclusion; restriction by taking out something which would otherwise be included, as in a class, statement, rule.
secondary_definitions: That which is excluded from others; a person, thing, or case, specified as distinct, or not included.
( law ) An objection , on legal grounds; also, as in conveyancing, a clause by which the grantor excepts or reserves something before the right is transferred.
( usually followed by to or against ) An objection; cavil ; dissent ; disapprobation; offense; cause of offense.
( programming ) An interruption in normal processing , typically caused by an error condition , that can be raised (" thrown ") by one part of the program and handled (" caught ") by another part.
